item.title: 苹果、谷歌和 Meta 遭欧盟调查，测试新数字法律
item.description: 苹果公司、Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司和 Meta Platforms 公司面临着可能被处以巨额罚款的风险，因为欧盟正在全面调查这些公司是否遵守了约束大型科技公司权力的严格的新法律。【原文：Apple Inc., Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Meta Platforms Inc. face the risk of potentially hefty fines as the European Union opened a full-blown investigation into the firms’ compliance with strict new laws reining in the power of Big Tech.】

item.title: 天然气需求回升，中石油利润飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 由于天然气需求的回升帮助这家中国能源巨头抵消了油价下跌的影响，中国石油天然气股份有限公司（PetroChina Co.【原文：PetroChina Co.’s annual profits rose to a record as a rebound in natural gas demand helped the Chinese energy major offset the impact of falling oil prices.】

item.title: 投资者权衡反对党的选举势头，塞内加尔债券下挫
item.description: 塞内加尔的美元债券周一在新兴市场信贷中表现最差，因为投资者在权衡反对党候选人在周日选举后赢得总统职位的可能性。【原文：Senegal’s dollar bonds were among the worst performers in emerging-market credit on Monday as investors weighed a chance of an opposition candidate winning the presidency after an election on Sunday.】

item.title: 美国宣布投入 60 亿美元清理重型制造业
item.description: 拜登政府正在向各公司发放约 60 亿美元的补助金，用于清理金属、造纸和玻璃等难以脱碳的行业，作为其中的一部分，美国 45 年来第一家新的铝冶炼厂或将建成。【原文：The first new US aluminum smelter in 45 years may be built as part of about $6 billion in grants the Biden administration is awarding to companies in a bid to clean-up hard to decarbonize industries including metal, paper and glass.】

item.title: 佳士得、苏富比宣布香港新空间开幕日期
item.description: 佳士得（Christie's）和苏富比（Sotheby's）两大拍卖行宣布了其在香港新址的开业日期。【原文：Major auction houses Christie’s and Sotheby’s have announced opening dates for their new spaces in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 华尔街熊市称若盈利不佳股市涨势将终结
item.description: 华尔街两位最看跌的策略师表示，如果公司盈利令人失望，那么今年推动美股创下新纪录的涨势将停滞不前。【原文：A rally that’s pushed US stocks to a new record this year will stall if company earnings disappoint, according to two of Wall Street’s most bearish strategists.】

item.title: 伊拉克和石油公司互相指责对方造成重要石油管道延误
item.description: 伊拉克政府和在该国北部开展业务的石油公司相互指责对方拖延恢复通往土耳其的一条关键输油管道，双方的分歧可能导致这条输油管道关闭更长时间。【原文：Iraq’s government and oil companies working in the country’s north blamed each other for delays in resuming a key pipeline to Turkey, divisions that could keep the link shut for even longer.】

item.title: 停电次数减少，南非消费者情绪好转
item.description: 2024 年第一季度，南非消费者信心略有提高，因为国家经济和家庭财务前景更加光明，而且滚动停电的频率也有所降低。【原文：South African consumer confidence improved slightly in the first quarter of 2024 amid brighter prospects for the nation’s economy and household finances, and as the frequency of rolling power cuts eased.】

item.title: 相信人工智能对中产阶级大有裨益的经济学家
item.description:
如果所有人都错了呢？【原文：

What if everyone is wrong.

】

item.title: CATL 与特斯拉合作开发快速充电电池，为内华达州供货
item.description: 当代安培瑞斯科技有限公司（Amperex Technology Co.埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的特斯拉公司正在为其开发充电速度更快的电池，这家汽车制造商正努力捍卫其市场份额，并推出售价低于 2.5 万美元的电动汽车。【原文：Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is working on faster charging batteries for Tesla Inc. as Elon Musk’s automaker seeks to defend its market share and roll out an electric car for under $25,000.】

item.title: 莫斯科袭击案嫌犯出庭受审，两人认罪
item.description: 俄罗斯当局播放了四名男子在法庭上被控实施莫斯科音乐厅致命袭击的录像，经过审讯，他们的籍贯被追溯到塔吉克斯坦。【原文：Russian authorities showed footage of four men charged in court with carrying out the deadly Moscow concert hall attack after interrogations that traced their origins to Tajikistan.】

item.title: 中国大型矿商称美国主导的遏制措施是增长的风险所在
item.description: 中国收购能力最强的矿业集团之一紫金矿业集团股份有限公司警告说，美国主导的应对中国政府控制矿产的努力可能会减缓该公司的全球扩张。【原文：Zijin Mining Group Co., one of China’s most acquisitive mining groups, warned that US-led efforts to tackle Beijing’s control of minerals could slow the company’s global expansion.】

item.title: 赞比亚和津巴布韦将重新招标 50 亿美元的巴托卡水电站
item.description: 一位官员表示，赞比亚和津巴布韦正在重新招标一个价值 50 亿美元的水电站建设项目，该项目之前由通用电气公司和中国电力建设集团公司中标，预计将在明年 9 月之前选出新的投标人。【原文：Zambia and Zimbabwe are retendering a $5 billion project to build a hydropower plant they previously awarded to General Electric Co. and Power Construction Corp. of China, and expect to select new bidders by September next year, an official said.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市触及一年来最高点后将出现回调
墨西哥总统阿姆鲁称特朗普的边境墙威胁只是竞选言论
item.description: 墨西哥总统安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔（Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador）在接受美国哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS）"60 分钟 "节目罕见的电视采访时，驳斥了美国总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普关于在墨西哥边境修建隔离墙的言论，称其只是竞选言论。【原文：Mexico’s President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador dismissed US presidential hopeful Donald Trump’s talk of a wall at the Mexican border as campaign rhetoric, in a rare TV interview with US network CBS’s 60 Minutes program.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 棕榈油因出口强劲和印尼政策担忧而反弹
item.description: 棕榈油结束了连续两日的下跌，原因是市场对马来西亚本月出口强劲持乐观态度，同时也担心印尼潜在的政策变化可能会限制这个最大发货国的供应。【原文：Palm oil snapped a two-day drop on optimism that Malaysian exports will be robust this month, and on concerns that potential Indonesian policy changes could limit supplies from the biggest shipper.】

item.title: 红客登月不会掀起 IPO 热潮
item.description:
大多数独角兽进入市场的几率与找到一匹神奇角马的几率差不多。【原文：

The chance of most unicorns getting to market is about as likely as finding a magical horned horse.

】

item.title: 生物安全法》领导人退出国会，药明康德、艾普泰克业绩大增
item.description: 药明生物开曼公司及其姊妹公司药明康德股份有限公司（WuXi AppTec Co.【原文：Shares of WuXi Biologics Cayman Inc. and its sister company WuXi AppTec Co. gained in Hong Kong after a US lawmaker sponsoring a bill that would block the companies from federal contracts said he will leave the House next month.】

item.title: 日本小林制药公司因补药召回而陷入困境
item.description: 日本制药商小林制药株式会社在宣布因用户投诉肾脏问题而召回补充剂药片后，股价将跌至每日限额。【原文：Shares of Japanese drugmaker Kobayashi Pharmaceutical Co. were set to fall by the daily limit after announcing a recall of supplement pills following complaints of kidney issues by users.】

item.title: 日本决策者对日元措辞的交易指南
item.description: 在央行加息未能提振日元之后，日元对美元汇率距离三十年来的低点已近在咫尺，这重新点燃了日本政府自 2022 年秋季以来首次涉足外汇市场的风险。【原文：The yen is within striking distance of a three-decade low against the dollar after a central bank interest rate hike failed to give it a lift, reigniting the risk of Japan’s government stepping into the foreign exchange market for the first time since autumn 2022.】

item.title: 展望中国市场，铁矿石保持 9 月以来最佳单周涨幅
item.description: 铁矿石保持了六个月来的最大单周涨幅，原因是人们对头号消费国中国经济复苏的乐观情绪悄然升温。【原文：Iron ore held its largest weekly advance in six months on quietly increasing optimism over the chances of an economic recovery in top consumer China.】

item.title: 高盛称央行降息将使大宗商品受益
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Commodities will advance this year as central banks in the US and Europe move to reduce interest rates, helping to support industrial and consumer demand, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 日本的金融中心雄心引起全球更多关注
item.description: 一位监管部门的高级官员说，日本正在吸引更多外国资产管理公司的兴趣，政府将东京改造成一个主要金融中心的努力引发了这一兴趣。【原文：Japan is attracting more interest from foreign asset managers, sparked by the government’s drive to remake Tokyo into a major financial hub, a top regulatory official said.】

item.title: 香港大型物业周末成交量下滑 32
item.description: 香港取消房地产限购令后，二手房市场在短暂反弹后逐渐降温，凸显了该行业面临的挑战。【原文：Hong Kong’s secondhand home market is cooling down after a brief rebound following the city’s removal of property curbs, underscoring the sector’s challenges.】

item.title: 里约热内卢最臭名昭著的谋杀案六年后结案
item.description: 巴西警方逮捕了 2018 年暗杀里约热内卢女议员玛丽埃尔-佛朗哥（Marielle Franco）的涉嫌主谋，她的暴力死亡震惊了巴西人，后来成为全国打击有罪不罚现象的象征。【原文：Brazil police arrested the alleged masterminds of the 2018 assassination of Marielle Franco, a Rio de Janeiro councilwoman whose violent death shocked Brazilians, later becoming a symbol of the fight against impunity across the nation.】

item.title: TPG 将把 50 亿美元新亚洲基金中的中国投资减半
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，TPG 公司即将关闭其第八个亚洲收购基金，该基金规模约为 50 亿美元，与之前的地区基金相比，新的投资组合将把中国市场的投资比例削减一半以上。【原文：TPG Inc. will soon close its eighth Asia buyout fund at around $5 billion, with the new portfolio set to slash its China allocation by more than half from prior regional funds, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国人民银行通过定盘价发出强烈支持信号，人民币反弹
item.description: 在中国央行通过一个强于预期的每日参考汇率发出支持有管理货币的信号后，中国人民币收窄了周五的跌幅。【原文：China’s yuan pared losses seen Friday after the central bank signaled its support for the managed currency via a stronger-than-expected daily reference rate.】

item.title: 埃克森签署氨协议，力争氢能税收抵免
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）在与日本最大的电力供应商 JERA Co.【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. pressed the case for hydrogen produced from natural gas to receive US tax credits under the Inflation Reduction Act after signing an accord to sell the low-carbon fuel to JERA Co., Japan’s biggest power provider.】

item.title: 英国北方橡树银行启动美国扩张，利润大幅增长
item.description: 橡树北方银行（OakNorth Bank Plc）报告称，受贷款增加和开始向美国扩张的推动，去年的税前利润猛增了 23%。【原文：OakNorth Bank Plc reported a 23% jump in pretax profit last year, driven by increased lending and the start of its US expansion.】
